findings.rationale: Limiting liability to fees paid in the last 6 months may not cover significant damages, exposing the Client to financial risk.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider's liability is limited to the fees paid in the 6 months preceding the claim.

findings.rationale: Indemnification is only to the extent required by applicable law, which may not provide sufficient protection in all scenarios.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider shall indemnify Client to the extent required by applicable law for third-party claims.

findings.rationale: Requiring negotiation before litigation may prolong resolution and increase costs for the Client.
findings.evidence_quote: Disputes shall be resolved through negotiation, then litigation if negotiation fails.

findings.rationale: A 3-year confidentiality obligation may not be sufficient depending on the nature of the information shared.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations survive termination for 3 years.

findings.rationale: Disclaiming all warranties except those specifically stated could leave the Client without recourse for defects or issues.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider disclaims all warranties, express or implied, except as specifically stated.
